Metadata: Morphological development and allometric growth patterns in hatchery-reared California halibut larvae

Californian halibut "Paralichthys californicus," a pleuronectid, is a highly valued fish species along the Western Coast of the U.S. The objectives of this study were to (1) describe the morphological development and allometric growth patterns and (2) present a comprehensive staging series for hatchery-reared California halibut from hatching to metamorphosis.
